Legal_Issue: Whether the Immigration and Refugee Board erred in dismissing the appeal based on marriage being primarily for immigration purposes
Credibility_Assessment: Board found applicant's testimony implausible due to inconsistencies and lack of corroborating evidence
Evidence_Type: Testimonial evidence, inconsistencies in statements, knowledge of marital partner
Basis_of_Claim: Second marriage was not genuine and entered primarily for immigration purposes
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Credibility of the applicant and plausibility of the marriage
Review_Outcome: Decision upheld; no patent unreasonableness found
Assessment_Standard: Patently unreasonable standard applied to review Board's findings
Application_Factor: Intent to reside permanently with spouse
Decision_Review_Issue: Whether Board made an error in assessing marital intent
Cause_of_Refusal: Marriage deemed primarily for immigration purposes
Evidentiary_Issues: Inconsistencies in testimony, husband's limited knowledge of applicant's background
Credibility_Issues: Applicant's credibility challenged due to inconsistent statements and implausible remarriage timeline
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to Board's finding of lack of genuine marital intent
Procedural_Issue: Standard of review applicable to credibility assessments by administrative tribunals
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Marriage entered primarily for immigration purposes
